messages.tapLocation: Tap a location on the map

insights.addLocation: Search for an address to get your analyses started!

placeholders.howDoesYourCityScore: How does your neighborhood score in terms of accessibility?

introduction.editPersonalData: Do you want to edit your personal mobility flower?
introduction.proximityFlowerDesc: The 'Proximity Flower' helps map people's preferred city amenities in relation to the distance to their homes
introduction.howDoesYourFlowerLook: How does your flower looks like?
introduction.projectDescription: This project is funded by EIT Urban Mobility, an initiative of the European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT), a body of the European Union. EIT Urban Mobility acts to accelerate positive change on mobility to make urban spaces more liveable. Learn more:
introduction.resetToStandardConfirmation: Are you sure that you want to reset all the travel time preference settings of your personal mobility flower to 15 minutes?

survey.surveyDescription: Make a selection of the distance in minutes for the locations that are relevant for you (create your ideal city). The travel times are mode-independent.

tutorial.Map4CitizensminuteDesc: The aim of this application is to provide citizens with detailed information about their sustainable mobility options and local accessibility.
tutorial.15-minCityDesc: This is strongly linked to the concept of the 15-min-city. To assist you in finding your perfect 15-min-city location, which fulfills all your needs, you can create your personal “flower-of-proximity”. The application then shows you how well different locations in the city can serve your needs.
tutorial.isochronesDesc: By calculating isochrones, you can get a feeling how far you can travel by foot, bike and public transport, and which amenities you can reach. Furthermore, you can activate additional layers such as Noise Levels, Population Density, Land use and Public Transport Qualities.
tutorial.readyToUseDesc:
With this application, we want assist citizens in getting a better understanding for their city and foster sustainable decisions. 
 Have fun!
tutorial.giveUsFeedback: Would you like to give us feedback?
tutorial.giveUsFeedbackDesc: We look forward to receiving your comments and suggestions for improvement:
